item.title: Designing relational databases
item.description: The goal of relational database design is to produce a set of relation schemas that have the features: Store information without redundancy. Allows us to retrieve information easily. This is achieved by designing schemas that are in an appropriate normal form. To determine whether a relation schema is in one of the desirable normal forms, we need information about the problem domain. Usually, this is modelled using a well-designed Entity-Relationship (ER) diagram.
